core_meaning.legge_1899_public_domain: K ien suggests to us the marriage of a young lady, and the good fortune (attending it). There will be advantage in being firm and correct.
core_meaning.normalized_summary: Gradual, step-by-step progress. Like a proper marriage or geese advancing in stages, success comes through patience, timing, and steady correctness—not leaps or force.

translations.text: The first SIX, divided, shows the wild geese gradually approaching the shore. A young officer (in similar circumstances) will be in a position of danger, and be spoken against; but there will be no error.
初六：鴻漸於干，小子厲，有言，無咎。

lines.normalized_meaning: Beginnings are exposed and precarious. Expect criticism and some danger, but keep to the right path and you’ll avoid real blame.

translations.text: The second SIX, divided, shows the geese gradually approaching the large rocks, where they eat and drink joyfully and at ease. There will be good fortune.
六二：鴻漸於磐，飲食衎衎，吉。

lines.normalized_meaning: A stable ledge appears. Nourish, consolidate, and rest. Progress is gentle and auspicious here.

translations.text: The third NINE, undivided, shows them gradually advanced to the dry plains. (It suggests also the idea of) a husband who goes on an expedition from which he does not return, and of a wife who is pregnant, but will not nourish her child. There will be evil. (The case symbolised) might be advantageous in resisting plunderers.
九三：鴻漸於陸，夫征不復，婦孕不育，凶；利禦寇。

lines.normalized_meaning: Overextension dries things out. Bonds strain; plans miscarry. Pull back or redirect into defense and protection.

translations.text: The fourth SIX, divided, shows the geese gradually advanced to the trees. They may light on the flat branches. There will be no error.
六四：鴻漸於木，或得其桷，無咎。

lines.normalized_meaning: A modest perch is enough. Choose the steady branch over the risky height. Safe, correct placement avoids blame.

translations.text: The fifth NINE, undivided, shows the geese gradually advanced to the high mound. (It suggests the idea of) a wife who for three years does not become pregnant; but in the end the natural issue cannot be prevented. There will be good fortune.
九五：鴻漸於陵，婦三歲不孕，終莫之勝，吉。

lines.normalized_meaning: Long delay, then fruition. Stay true during the wait; what is natural and right ultimately prevails.

translations.text: The sixth NINE, undivided, shows the geese gradually advanced to the large heights (beyond). Their feathers can be used as ornaments. There will be good fortune.
上九：鴻漸於逵，其羽可用為儀，吉。

lines.normalized_meaning: Arrival with honor. The journey yields offerings and symbols of legitimacy. Share the virtue; adorn the rite.
